instructions: Do not walk or drive through flood waters.
Turn off utilities at the main switches if instructed.
Keep an emergency kit ready with food, water, and medicines.
Stay alert for sudden changes in water flow or earth movement.
If you are near a stream or channel, be alert for sudden changes in water levels.
Move out of the path of a landslide or debris flow as quickly as possible.
If escape is impossible, curl into a tight ball and protect your head.
Evacuate immediately if you hear unusual sounds like trees cracking.
Stay indoors and keep your house cool.
Drink plenty of water even if not thirsty.
Avoid strenuous physical activity during peak heat hours (11am - 3pm).
Wear lightweight, light-colored, loose cotton clothes.
Help the elderly and children stay hydrated.
